introduction.title: The "Last Leg" Impaired Driving Challenge
introduction.content: Driving under the influence of alcohol or drugs remains a persistent highway safety issue, causing over 10,000 deaths annually in the U.S. One emerging challenge is the "last leg" of a multimodal trip â€“ when an individual drives to a commuter rail station, takes transit into a city to socialize and consume alcohol, then returns by train and still must drive a few miles home. This toolkit provides comprehensive strategies to address this critical safety gap.

cards.title: CASE STUDIES
cards.description: Explore real-world examples of successful programs that have tackled similar challenges, from rural Wisconsin's "Road Crew" to New Jersey's "Evesham Saves Lives" initiative.

cards.title: DIGITAL TOOLS
cards.description: Discover a taxonomy of innovative technologies that can help prevent or mitigate last-leg impaired driving, from ridesharing integration to impairment detection apps.

cards.title: IMPLEMENTATION
cards.description: Learn how to put these ideas into practice with clear guidance on partnerships, funding, policy adjustments, and program deployment.

cards.title: RESOURCES
cards.description: Access communication strategies, outreach materials, and research priorities to support your impaired driving prevention efforts.
